 wait      and do not recognize us

Code:
```py
poem_text = """
**Father Son and Holy Ghost**

I have not ever seen my father’s grave.

 Not that his judgment eyes

 have been forgotten

 nor his great hands’ print

 on our evening doorknobs

       one half turn each night

       and he would come

       drabbled with the world’s business

       massive and silent

       as the whole day’s wish

       ready to redefine

       each of our shapes

 but now the evening doorknobs

 wait      and do not recognize us

 as we pass.

 Each week a different woman

 regular as his one quick glass

 each evening

 pulls up the grass his stillness grows

 calling it weed.

 Each week      a different woman

 has my mother’s face

 and he

 who time has      changeless

 must be amazed

 who knew and loved

 but one.

 My father died in silence

 loving creation

 and well-defined response

 he lived      still judgments

 on familiar things

 and died     
knowing

 a January 15th that year me.

 Lest I go into dust

 I have not ever seen my father’s grave.
"""

# Analyzing the poem for indentation
stanza_lines = poem_text.split('\n\n')
stanza_with_indentation = []

for index, stanza in enumerate(stanza_lines):
    if any(line.startswith(' ') for line in stanza.split('\n')):
        stanza_with_indentation.append(index + 1)  # Stanza numbers are 1-based

print("Stanzas with indentation:", stanza_with_indentation)
stanza_number = stanza_with_indentation[0] if stanza_with_indentation else None
```
